page.title: 11COMMANDER CAREY
page.content: One of the most notable buiildings in Fairford is{Fairford House,}owned by{Commander Carey}who has lived there since l969. He takes a very active role in the community mainly in charitable organisations. When he originally came here he was on the county council and later he became the chairman of the Governors of Farmor's School. He has now retired from this position. He is not only{chairman {of the Friends of Fairford church but {also of Fairford Hospital.} He has been on the town council and Parochial Church Council. He is a knight of the order of St. John of Jerusalem and is involved in the St. John Ambulance Brigade. {Fairford House is Georgian and has significant architectural features. The grounds are used for functions such as church fetes.
